pageContext.title: noImplicitUseStrict
pageContext.html:
You shouldnâ€™t need this. By default, when emitting a module file to a non-ES6 target, TypeScript emits a "use strict"; prologue at the top of the file. This setting disables the prologue.

// @showEmit
// @target: ES3
// @module: AMD
// @noImplicitUseStrict
// @alwaysStrict: false
export function fn() {}

// @showEmit
// @target: ES3
// @module: AMD
export function fn() {}
